title: Establishes training and registration requirements for kidney dialysis patient care technicians
summary: Establishes training and registration requirements for kidney dialysis patient care technicians.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          455

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  GIBSON, WEISENBERG, BARRON, MILLMAN, CASTRO,
         ARROYO, MAYERSOHN -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BOYLAND, DINOWITZ,
         HOOPER, MAISEL, NOLAN, TOWNS -- read once and referred to the  Commit-
         tee on Health

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  public  health law, in relation to establishing
         training and registration requirements  for  kidney  dialysis  patient
         care technicians

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The public health law is amended by adding  a  new  article
    2  37-A to read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 37-A
    4                           KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT
    5                              CARE TECHNICIANS
    6  SECTION 3720. DEFINITIONS.
    7          3721. TRAINING.
    8          3722. PRACTICE OF KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE.
    9          3723. EXEMPTION.
   10    S 3720. DEFINITIONS. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS ARTICLE:
   11    1.  "KIDNEY  DIALYSIS  PATIENT  CARE TECHNICIAN" MEANS ANY PERSON, NOT
   12  LICENSED TO PRACTICE MEDICINE OR NURSING, OR AS A PHYSICIAN ASSISTANT OR
   13  SPECIALIST ASSISTANT, WHO PERFORMS KIDNEY DIALYSIS SERVICES ON  A  HUMAN
   14  AND  HAS  SUCCESSFULLY  COMPLETED  THE TRAINING REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED
   15  PURSUANT TO SECTION THIRTY-SEVEN HUNDRED TWENTY-ONE OF THIS ARTICLE  AND
   16  THE  REGISTRATION REQUIREMENT OF SECTION THIRTY-SEVEN HUNDRED TWENTY-TWO
   17  OF THIS ARTICLE.
   18    2. "KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE TECHNICIAN TRAINEE" MEANS ANY PERSON,
   19  NOT LICENSED TO PRACTICE MEDICINE OR NURSING, OR AS A PHYSICIAN  ASSIST-
   20  ANT  OR SPECIALIST ASSISTANT, WHO PERFORMS KIDNEY DIALYSIS SERVICES ON A
   21  HUMAN AND HAS ENROLLED IN OR COMPLETED THE TRAINING REQUIRED BY  SECTION

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00175-01-1

       A. 455                              2

    1  THIRTY-SEVEN  HUNDRED  TWENTY-ONE OF THIS ARTICLE AND HAS NOT REGISTERED
    2  PURSUANT TO SECTION THIRTY-SEVEN HUNDRED TWENTY-TWO OF THIS ARTICLE.
    3    S  3721.  TRAINING.  1.  THE  COMMISSIONER,  IN  CONSULTATION WITH THE
    4  COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION, SHALL  ESTABLISH  TRAINING  REQUIREMENTS  FOR
    5  KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE TECHNICIANS.
    6    2. SUCH TRAINING REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION AND
    7  THE  RULES  AND  REGULATIONS  PROMULGATED BY THE COMMISSIONER SHALL HAVE
    8  CLEARLY DEFINED CRITERIA FOR EVALUATING  EACH  TRAINEE'S  ATTAINMENT  OF
    9  TRAINING  GOALS AND COMPETENCY IN PROVISION OF KIDNEY DIALYSIS SERVICES.
   10  KIDNEY  DIALYSIS  PATIENT  CARE  TECHNICIAN  TRAINING  PROGRAMS  MAY  BE
   11  CONDUCTED BY:
   12    (A) KIDNEY DIALYSIS PROVIDERS;
   13    (B) DEGREE AND NON-DEGREE GRANTING INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION AS
   14  DEFINED  IN  SECTION  TWO  OF  THE EDUCATION LAW, CHARTERED, APPROVED OR
   15  LICENSED BY THE BOARD OF REGENTS; OR
   16    (C) ANY OTHER ENTITY APPROVED BY THE COMMISSIONER TO  CONDUCT  SUCH  A
   17  PROGRAM.
   18    3.  THE TRAINING ESTABLISHED BY THIS SECTION SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE
   19  LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING TOPICS:
   20    (A) AN OVERVIEW OF THE ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF  KIDNEY  DIALYSIS
   21  PATIENT CARE TECHNICIANS;
   22    (B) AN OVERVIEW OF KIDNEY DIALYSIS THERAPY; AND
   23    (C)  THE  LEGAL  ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT
   24  CARE TECHNICIANS.
   25    S 3722. PRACTICE OF KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE. 1. EXCEPT AS  OTHER-
   26  WISE  PROVIDED  BY  THIS  ARTICLE, NO PERSON SHALL USE THE TITLE "KIDNEY
   27  DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE TECHNICIAN" NOR PROVIDE KIDNEY DIALYSIS  SERVICES,
   28  AS SUCH SERVICES ARE DEFINED BY THE COMMISSIONER, UNLESS SUCH PERSON HAS
   29  COMPLETED THE TRAINING REQUIRED PURSUANT TO SECTION THIRTY-SEVEN HUNDRED
   30  TWENTY-ONE  OF  THIS  ARTICLE,  AND  HAS  REGISTERED WITH THE DEPARTMENT
   31  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION.
   32    2. UPON THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE TRAINING REQUIRED PURSUANT TO
   33  SECTION THIRTY-SEVEN HUNDRED TWENTY-ONE OF THIS ARTICLE,  A  PERSON  MAY
   34  REGISTER  WITH  THE  DEPARTMENT TO BECOME A KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE
   35  TECHNICIAN.
   36    3. A KIDNEY DIALYSIS PATIENT CARE TECHNICIAN  AND  A  KIDNEY  DIALYSIS
   37  PATIENT  CARE  TECHNICIAN  TRAINEE  SHALL  BE AUTHORIZED TO PERFORM SUCH
   38  PROCEDURES AND ACTIVITIES AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL DEEM APPROPRIATE FOR
   39  THE LEVEL OF TRAINING COMPLETED BY SUCH TECHNICIAN OR TRAINEE.
   40    S 3723. EXEMPTION. THE  PROVISIONS  OF  SECTION  THIRTY-SEVEN  HUNDRED
   41  TWENTY-TWO  OF  THIS  ARTICLE  SHALL NOT APPLY, UNTIL ONE YEAR AFTER THE
   42  EFFECTIVE DATE OF SUCH SECTION, TO ANY PERSON WHO, ON THE EFFECTIVE DATE
   43  OF SUCH SECTION, HAS BEEN PROVIDING KIDNEY DIALYSIS SERVICES FOR A PERI-
   44  OD OF NOT LESS THAN TWO YEARS.
   45    S 2. This act shall take effect on the three hundred  sixty-fifth  day
   46  after it shall have become a law; provided, however, the commissioner of
   47  health  is  immediately  authorized and directed to promulgate any rules
   48  and regulations necessary to implement the provisions of section 3722 of
   49  the public health law on the effective date thereof.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to establishing training and registration requirements for kidney dialysis patient care technicians
